pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a predicate `Language.IsRegular` in a similar way `Language.IsContextFree` is defined.

nodes.body: Please check that the universe levels are done correctly!
We really need to move `IsRegular` (for regular elements) out from the root namespace...

> We really need to move `IsRegular` (for regular elements) out from the root namespace...

https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Regular/Basic.html#IsRegular

Yeah!
Can we proceed now regardless?

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10617754120/job/29431366759)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10617754120/job/29431365941)

Actually the standard is to have
```
open ...
open scoped ...

universe ...
variable ...
```
It's important to have `open ...`/`open scoped ...` before `variable ...` because the latter might use some names or notations only accessible in a namespace, and `universe` is a very close cousin of `variable` so should stay next to it

OK, then it should probably make sense to replace
```
def Language.IsRegular {T : Type u}
```
by
```
def Language.IsRegular {T : Type*}
```
right?
However, I am not sure the existentially-quantified type will accept `Type*` in place of `Type v`.
All I'm saying is that you should revert the change I've commented on
Did you take into account that the universes are used outside of the section as well as inside it?

```suggestion
/-- A regular language is a language that is defined by a DFA with finite states. -/
```

This is a bad definition, in that the universe variable `v` only shows up in the body of the definition and not in the arguments. This is problematic as you then have countably many predicate `IsRegular.{0}`, `IsRegular.{1}`, `IsRegular.{2}`, ... which are all equivalent.

Please do
```suggestion
/-- A regular language is a language that is defined by a DFA with finite states. -/
def Language.IsRegular {T : Type u} (L : Language T) : Prop :=
  âˆƒ Ïƒ : Type, âˆƒ _ : Fintype Ïƒ, âˆƒ M : DFA T Ïƒ, M.accepts = L

lemma Language.isRegular_iff {T : Type u} {L : Language T}
    L.IsRegular â†” âˆƒ Ïƒ : Type v, âˆƒ _ : Fintype Ïƒ, âˆƒ M : DFA T Ïƒ, M.accepts = L := sorry
```
which will involve using `Shrink` and importing `Mathlib.Data.Countable.Small`
Unfortunately, I don't understand how `Shrink` works, so let's keep it at `proof_wanted` in this PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Computability): define `Language.IsRegular`
